Reviews.Title: “Concur with other reviewers...”
Reviews.Author: ParisGirl90210
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderfully situated; you can walk most anywhere and you'll not be without options for food...Plus if you've read DaVinci Code you'll appreciate being around the corner from Saint Sulpice church (though they aren't big DaVinci code fans there, so be mindful) ...That said, I can honestly say I have never stayed in a noisier hotel in my life. Definitely wanna pack those Bose headsets for this one. There's a party down below most every night. (Felt like the Cancun of Paris...Lots of college kids and drinking (and singing) crowds!) Ok if prepared for it, as the price is fair. But do not go without earplugs or headset if you wish to sleep~ Only other downside is this: They give you one key per room; it has an electronic fob to get you INTO the building at night AND locks your room door (with regular key) both from inside and out. (I.e. no other option to lock yourself IN, but with the key....which means, if one person leaves to go out for a bit, the other has the option of a) going out at the same time and staying out the exact same time; b) staying IN in an unlocked room; or c) being locked IN the room until the other returns with the key. Not only could this be a fire hazard, it was just hard to plan around, as the key is on a rather large fob and not easily hidden if that's your plan for sharing it. Hope this helps. Otherwise, enjoyed the stay. (After all, you're in Paris, right?) The mini fridge and kitchenette came in very handy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Elaina85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights last year in July. We didnt want to stay anywhere too pricy and not too far out of town. Wa s a bit concerened about this one because of the reviews on here but found it to be better than expected. There is no reception and all communication was done over the phone, but found Lara to be quite nice and helpful. The room was quite small but it was fine for us becuase we were only there to sleep. It was quite, comfortable and clean which is alll that we were after. One thing that would have been nice a kettle and plates and cups to be provided, but other than that it was fine. We walked from there to all main attrations, the furthest away was the Eiffel tower, which took about 45 minutes. This hotel did the job for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: Great location in St Germain. Very close to metro station. It's clean, and the bathroom was really renovated. It's a no-frills hotel, so don't expect any concierge service. It doesn't even have a lobby or a breakfast area. But if you're like me and are just looking for a reasonably priced hotel that is convenient and clean, this hotel is perfect. Some other reviewers complained about the noise on the streets. I faced the interior, so I didn't have any problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “total waste of money”
Reviews.Author: carmolar
Reviews.Content: It would have been a lot quieter to sleep in the train station, and probably more comfortable too. The fact that they charge so much money and give you a single bed and small loveseat (not pull-out) to sleep three people is just very, offensively, - French

Reviews.Title: “Truly not recommended for a stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Ana C
Reviews.Content: I think it could be a nice place to stay if you are in paris for parting... But if you are there with kids for any other reasons it is really not the place to stay! It is in one of the nosiest street of paris by night, so noise doesn't stop until 5 in the morning and... No double glazing! The lift is not suitable for a normal stroller so it is just a nighmare to access your room when baby is asleep! Bathroom is so tiny that giving bath to kids is also a nighmare..... But again if you are not with kids and you love the vibes of paris night I think it can be really enjoyable! Service is poor!

Reviews.Title: “Unbearably noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa F
Reviews.Content: We were on the 4th floor and couldn't hear each other talk it was so loud! We tried to sleep with ear plugs and pillows over our heads. There are several bars right below on the narrow street and they don't close; they are open all night. We were there on a weekend and it was the World Cup Rugby match and France played. They had music blarring with base on high, they sang, they cheered and it was unbelievable. There is also no maid service or clean linens on the weekends. There is only a voice on the other end of the phone; you never see a person. Usually when we called we got a voicemail. The elevator was so small that an average person with their suitcase barely fits. If you are overweight you would have to take the spiral stairs. The price is good and it was clean, but if you want to sleep, I would not stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wacko_654
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days in the 130 Euro room (Room 30). Booked through Expedia, called ahead to coordinate arrival like in previous review. Perfect English is spoken by lady on other side of the line. When arrived we were buzzed in and the key waiting for us in the room. Very convenient. The room was very spacious: queen size bed, sofa couch (maybe even bed?), coffee table, full bath and a kitchenette. Everything sparkling clean and new! The windows are facing the quite busy street, so you could just pour yourself a glass of wine and sit in the window watching the crowds, or close the windows for quiet and privacy. The location is amazing: 2 metro stations within 2 min radius, lots of bus lines and within walking distance to all of central Paris. The neighborhood is awesome: Lots of pubs, bistros, cafes and shops. For groceries use the Monoprix on Rue de Rennes - 3 minutes walk There is a great boulangerie less then a minute away - Gerard Mulot on the corner of Rue Lobineau and Rue de Seine - Baguettes, Croissants and 5 star cakes and sweets. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: gdcuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights over the bank holiday weekend. Perfect base to explore paris. Set in the vibrant st germain area. Perfect position for metro, went to Rock en Seine festival and the metro took us from door to door. Accomodation is simple and compact and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Florida Family's first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: coolgal500
Reviews.Content: 2 adults, 2 kids. Stayed 4 nights. Room 50/Duplex. Felt like we stayed in an apartment. No reception area but confirmed arrival ahead of time and the person who let us in was only a phone call away. We were given Room Key and electronic key fob to enter building. Very easy to use. small spiral staircase. Small elevator lift. DID not have any problems going to 5th floor during my stay. Rarely saw other guests. Very private. Did not mind the outside noise late at night from the busy night life. ROOM: Sofabed, half bath, kitchenette with dinette area on lower level. Double bed, full bath, closet, huge counter space, 2 skylights in loft area. Kitchenette has basic cooking and eating utensils, microwave, and fridge. Was able to cook light breakfast. Bought groceries from Monoprix less than 10 min walk on Rue d'Rennes. Daily cleaning. super clean Bathrooms and kitchenette. Fresh towels and Bed linens. You will need electrical converter with adapter for US electronics. AREA: Loved the lively area. easy walk to Metro. 2 blocks from major street with shopping/Dining. 10 min walk to Seine/Notre Dame. Streets are clean. Great selection of various cuisine/prices. GENERAL: We advise that you get the Paris Pass for sight seeing and tours. Can be purchased online. French people and tourists were extremely nice and we survived 6 days speaking English. Please do your research on location, getting around, cost of food, restaurant hours, and weather. We did our research and were very prepared. If you are traveling from the US..pack your favorite snacks and toiletries. Everything is more expensive considering the US Dollar/Euro exchange. Lots of restaurants in this area, but walk towards the Seine and Le Petit Pont area. Lots more to chose from and less expensive. FINAL ANSWER: Glad we chose this residence/hotel. Will definitely stay here again. Previous reviews were very helpful. Central to EVERYTHING!! The Latchmin Family Miami, Florida.

Reviews.Title: “super location!”
Reviews.Author: Citysurfchic
Reviews.Content: if you dont care about the room, this is super. rel. clean.... find a pair of old man trousers in the wardrobe.. hehe. but otherwise.. CLEAN. they have no reception so you had to take cre of everything by your own. i loved it! i will for sure stay here again.. good rates for the room if you think about the location! but.. bring some earplugs or something, because it can be a littlebit to screamy in the streets from glad drunk people (its some bars just outside the hotel. ) but otherwise... enjoy:)

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding location, great value, highest possible recommendation”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandCristina
Reviews.Content: We spent five night at the Residences St Sulpice between Christmas and New Year and coul not have been happier. It is in a fantastic location - walking distance from the Louvre and Notre Dame and in the very heart of one of the best shopping and eating areas you will come across in any city in the world. The room was not huge but it was plenty for two. It had a nice bathroom with bath / shower which was spotless and cleaned to a high standard daily. The hotel offers free wi-fi and best of all, the rooms have a small kitchenette with hob, fridge and microwave so you have the flexibility to cook you own meals if you don't want to pay Paris restaurant prices. There is a Monoprix (like Marks and Spencers) a couple of streets away for food. It is not a conventional hotel insofar as there is no reception desk or restaurant, it is more of a collection of self contained apartments in a beauitiful little building. We had a room at the back of the building and did not hear a single noise from outside - and we were there over Christmas and New Year! You do have to call to let them know when you are arriving but we did this when we arrived in Paris and were about 15 minutes away and it was no problem. You have a key for your room and an electronic fob for the front door so you can come and go as you please. Overall, this is a superb place to stay and would get our highest recommendaton even if it were more expensive, but it is tremendous value for Paris. Please do not focus on any negative reviews on this site, were were there in December 2010 and it is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - particularly if you dont wish to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: DukeandDuchessofyork
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is in a great location, tucked in behind cool little bars and cafes, and easily walkable to many other parts of Paris. The rooms were a good size, with little fridge and table and chairs to enjoy bread and wine and cheese! The lady who let us in spoke very little English, but it was manageable. The bars across the street are open very late, and there was a lot of noise til around 4am, but I would still recommend this place, and stay here again. St Germain is a gorgeous area!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: kazp02
Reviews.Content: Great location, near metro station, restaurants etc. Would recommend. Only downside is there no reception. You need to call to be let in etc. Good value. I also recommend the boulangerie at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelmariner
Reviews.Content: PROS: -The hotel was very cute and quirky with a lot of character and because we were on the top floor, we could see the eiffel tower from our sunroof. -The staff were able to accommodate us both checking in and checking out late. -The location is just fabulous! Very safe neighbourhood that is always vibrant and everything you could possibly need is within walking distance. -There is a metro station within a 5 minute walk that connects you with everything you could ever need. -Hot water and comfy beds! CONS -The room was tiny! we booked a 'duplex' room that we were informed was big enough to accommodate 4 adults. by the time we all lugged our bags in the small amount of space we had very quickly disappeared! -There is no room cleaning over the weekends! And because we stayed over new years where there was a public holiday we didn't have our beds made or get clean towels for three whole days! -You can't physically stand up in the shower because of how the room is shaped. I had baths and my boyfriend showered on his knees! All in all a great stay but make sure you plan ahead with your check in and check out times.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: cinzia707
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a variety of reviews for this place. MINUSES: Check your confirmation email, people!! It says: "This hotel does NOT have a reception desk. Contact the hotel to arrange arrival". So that's a minus--you have to check in when they tell you and it is not a moment before 10 am and probably not after 4:30 pm. There is NO ONE on the premises. I have no idea where the buzzer goes to or where the person who lets you in stays normally. The lift is like a half of a coffin--can hardly accommodate you and your rollie bag. There is no glass in the bathroom or anywhere else, even though I had a microwave and a mini-fridge. I called to ask , "are there any plates or silver I could use?" "No! You did not book a kitchen!" "Why is there a fridge and microwave here?" " You have them, but you did not book them" "Could I have a glass to rinse my mouth out after brushing my teeth?" "SIGH...!" Later a woman did bring me two coffee cups. "Could I have an extra blanket? It's very cold" (-2C outside). "No extra blankets. You have a heater". No internet. PLUSES: It's incredibly cheap for Paris. The bed was heavenly- solid foam. The pillows and linens were wonderful. The room (21) was completely quiet and i slept soundly--it was really too cold for people to be on the streets at night. The bathroom was new and pristine. The towels were great. The water was scalding. There was a tub and shower. It is in a lovely area. The key pad works better than most places that have codes. I didn't see anyone else. Conclusion: Book a room, thank your lucky stars for the price, and bring a cork screw and your own glass. Sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Budget place where you can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: SirJackBackFrom82
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris via eurostar from london with the gf and booked this place last minute. Firstly, really cheap and good value for money - its in a very central location, good for sights, restaurants, bars, metro stations and shopping. The price your paying is not for the quality of rooms or service. Our room was fine, although very noisy (we were on the 1st floor facing the street) not a huge problem but equally not the place to go to for peace and quiet - unless your higher up in the building where i imagine its better. Room was quite large with an ensuite and self contained with a small oven/sink - perfect for budget travellers who can't afford splashing the cash at the lovely but slightly pricey restaurants below. Nice parisian windows giving you a glimpse of a typical/but busy paris street. The only time i saw any staff was checking in/out, which was fine by me. its not a place where you're looked after, more of a place where you're left to your own devices - so don't expect much with service and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - took my 17 year old niece - very safe area - central to everything”
Reviews.Author: conistonGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in St Sulpice. The room was small but very, very clean, towels changed daily and room cleaned daily. the room had a very comfortable double bed, two very modern electic hobs, a microwave, a small fridge and plenty of utensils, pans etc. It also had a very small cupboard/wardrobe and a little barcony facing down into the middle. The toilet was spotless, small but there was a fairly big cupboard under sink for all our toiletries etc. Good sized bath and great shower. Al;though all the rooms were taken we didn't find it at all noisy but this was April so could be noisy in summer We got RER B train from Charles de Gaulle to St Michel- Notre Dame, took about 30 minutes then we went through and took Metro to Mabillon two stations, total cost 8 euros 60. Same ticket did both. Buy ticket at airport station as there is no-one on the train and you need it to get through, one ticket lasts all day. At Mabillon you are on the corner of Blvd St Germaiane and rue Four. As soon as you get into Rue Four you turn left almost immediately. You pass Gap shop and just opposite, on the right, is Rue Guisard, continue along past bars, shops, restaurants and you will see the flag for the hotel on the left. It is a very short street. I emailed my estimated time of arrival so just pressed the door bell and the lady was there in minutes. It is about two minutes walk from the Metro. The area has everything and it takes about ten/fifteen minutes to walk down to the Seine Would certainly recommend it although it is a bit small for more than a week's stay

Reviews.Title: “Ghastly experience!!! And they don't care!!!”
Reviews.Author: RetiredBrit
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I had booked a twin room with Eurostar. We could not find the place at 11:30 at night as the road is too small for street maps. Then we found a police station that helped us. The woman who let us in (we were expected to make an appointment to be admitted!) showed us to a small fourth-floor room with a small double bed with a dirty coverlet. She was unable to reallocate us and a call to the Directrice went unanswered. After a sleepless night and further unanswered calls to the Directrice we moved out to the Hotel des Grands Balcons nearby, where we had stayed before. That was good (110 euros/room) but the memory of that ghastly, miserable dump will stay with me for a long time. It simply is NOT a hotel and ought not to be styled as such.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware Safety Issue”
Reviews.Author: outoftown1
Reviews.Content: Hotels does not have front desk and they did not answer the ringer or cell phone.I arrived around midnight and was accosted by the local drunks outside hotel. I had to find anoter hotel that evening and when I went to hotel the next day the "weekend" help tried to tell me I never rang buzzer or called.She slept through it and then denied everything. Needless to say there are many issues to consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Afraid of mice? Better stay somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: singularity0
Reviews.Content: St.Germain is pretty and very popular for going out amongst the locals and the tourists, and the hotel is located in one of those little side streets that are filled with cafes and restaurants. When the weather is good, the cafe owners place chairs and tables on the street right in front of the hotel. We stayed on the first floor in a room facing the street, and the noise level in the room was just like sitting in the street. The cafes are busy even on weekdays and rarely close before 3 am, so even with wax earplugs we couldn't sleep at all until they closed. Unfortunately, construction in the street using a jackhammer started about three hours later. The hotel staff was friendly, but unable to relocate us to a different room since they were fully booked. They asked us to send any complaints we might have to Expedia. One of the chairs in the room was trashed, but the hotel staff was unable to provide a replacement. The bed was made by the room service, but they did not vacuum the room or empty the trash while we're away. The mouse which lived underneath the fridge appreciated that and came out of its hiding place at night. A written request for a mouse trap was ignored by the hotel staff. More observations: - the rooms facing away from the street are much quieter, but smallish and dark with no view - all bathrooms were recently renovated and really clean - the blanket had cigarette burn holes in it I'd urge you to avoid the rooms facing the street (they are the more expensive ones) unless you are deaf or you don't intend to sleep. Otherwise this place is okay, especially since it's located in the heart of Paris at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris, lush Apartment”
Reviews.Author: felicity_boo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a lush 4 day holiday for my 21st in Paris. ..stayed at the Apartments St Sulpice...the spiral staircase up four floors (our apartment was number 4! there are 5 floors with 2 apartments a floor!) is totally worth it...its in a perfect location, 5-10 minute stroll to the Seine, the Louvre and Notre Damn...spent the holiday wandering to the boulangerie on the corner and coffee shop on the next boulevard for pain au chocolat and croissants...yum! Would recommend the hotel to anyone, its clean, centrally located and ammenities are local. It was kitted out with all the things needed and being an Apartment was that little bit more private, as in other reviews the road can get a little noisy in the evening the best way to deal with this is to go sample the bars and restaurants outside... All in all. ..a lush hotel and an agreeable price! around 60-80 euro a night! x

Reviews.Title: “Bring the Noise”
Reviews.Author: wannafiji
Reviews.Content: Our stay here made me think of the song, "Bring The Noise," because that's what we got at Residence Hoteliere Saint Sulpice. The only thing wrong with this place is the noise level at night. Otherwise, it's really a fantastic deal. The property consists of about 10 rooms that are all situated off a narrow spiral staircase. A tiny 2-person elevator is available for those who don't like the spiral staircase. The rooms either face the street directly, or are off to the side a bit. It's well-situated, sitting just behind Saint Sulpice Church. There's a bakery down the street, small restaurants and cafes across the street, great designer shopping in the area, and 2 metro stops just 3 minutes away. It takes about 7 minutes to walk to the Seine. We stayed in a mini-apartment on the fourth floor that consisted of a small ante-room, a small bathroom, and a bedroom that had a mini-kitchen with sink, fridge, small cooktop, and table and chairs. The apartment came with dishes and silverware, an ironing board, daily housekeeping, flat panel TV, a phone, and some information on the area. Hot water was plentiful, water pressure was great, we were able to control the room temperature via the electrical heaters, and the place was very clean. The bathroom was very well lit and had modern fixtures. All in all, it was more than adequate, especially for 45 Euros per night (we got a killer deal through Travelocity). The only problem -- and a big problem at that -- was the noise level at night. Our apartment faced the street and the single-pane windows weren't thick enough to block the noise coming from below. The bars across the street cater to a younger crowd that likes to party and we heard a lot of drunken yelling until 4:00 a.m. every morning. That, coupled with the echoing cavernlike effect of every sound bouncing off the buildings made everything much louder than you'd expect. Even the sound of women walking in high-heeled boots was amplified. The sound of someone sneezing on the street was louder than a flush from the toilet upstairs. Needless to say, we didn't experience one good night of sleep during our one week stay there. I recommend bringing some serious earplugs if you plan to stay here, or calling the property directly and finding out if you can get a room that doesn't face the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but no sleep in a depressing room.”
Reviews.Author: meadowbay
Reviews.Content: The entrance hall is narrow, and full of strollers during our stay. Rooms are currently being retrofitted. Where new fixtures don't cover old fixtures, you can see how dirty the walls are. A new vanity in the bathroom is against the toilet, so you can not sit properly on the toilet. Where the shower hose was attached to the wall, it now lays in the tub. Unfortunately, everything looked worse because we could not get a good nights sleep. The brew pub down the street was partying until 4 am, and then the garbagemen came by at 6 am, collecting all the bottles. Management is only available for registration and departure, although they leave a contact number. This is a problem if you're shorted towels on Friday, and the maid doesn't come until Monday. Got the room on lastminute.com, and would have checked out early but we prepaid.

HotelInfo.Name: Saint Sulpice Residence Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 23 Rue Guisarde, 75006 Paris, France
